---
  description: Set guides for each scale and then convert them with ggplotly.
  function: guides
  permalink: /ggplot2/Guides axes and legends/guides/
  layout: base
  language: ggplot2
  name: guides
  reference: https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/
---

Note that using size for a discrete variable is not advised.

# Default ggplot object without guide specification


<pre class="mcode">
dat <- data.frame(x = 1:5, y = 1:5, p = 1:5, q = factor(1:5),
 r = factor(1:5))
p <-
  ggplot(dat, aes(x, y, colour = p, size = q, shape = r)) +
  geom_point()
  
plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

# Show colorbar guide for colour

<pre class="mcode">
dat <- data.frame(x = 1:5, y = 1:5, p = 1:5, q = factor(1:5),
 r = factor(1:5))

p <-
  ggplot(dat, aes(x, y, colour = p, size = q, shape = r)) +
  geom_point()

p <-  p + guides(colour = "colorbar", size = "legend", shape = "legend")

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

{% capture plot_432 %}

    raw_json_file=plot_432

You can also use `guide_colorbar()`, `guide_legend()`, `guide_legend()`, etc... this will result in the same plot as the previous example.



<pre class="mcode">
dat <- data.frame(x = 1:5, y = 1:5, p = 1:5, q = factor(1:5),
 r = factor(1:5))

p <-
  ggplot(dat, aes(x, y, colour = p, size = q, shape = r)) +
  geom_point()

p <-    
 p + guides(colour = guide_colorbar(), size = guide_legend(),
  shape = guide_legend())
  
plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

Using scale will also result in the same plot as the previous examples.


<pre class="mcode">
dat <- data.frame(x = 1:5, y = 1:5, p = 1:5, q = factor(1:5),
 r = factor(1:5))

p <-
  ggplot(dat, aes(x, y, colour = p, size = q, shape = r)) +
  geom_point()

p <-    
 p +
 scale_colour_continuous(guide = "colorbar") +
 scale_size_discrete(guide = "legend") +
 scale_shape(guide = "legend")
 
plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

# Remove guides


<pre class="mcode">
dat <- data.frame(x = 1:5, y = 1:5, p = 1:5, q = factor(1:5),
 r = factor(1:5))

p <-
  ggplot(dat, aes(x, y, colour = p, size = q, shape = r)) +
  geom_point()

p <-   p + guides(colour = "none")

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

<pre class="mcode">
dat <- data.frame(x = 1:5, y = 1:5, p = 1:5, q = factor(1:5),
 r = factor(1:5))

p <-
  ggplot(dat, aes(x, y, colour = p, size = q, shape = r)) +
  geom_point()

p <-   p + guides(colour = "none")

p <-   p + guides(colour = "colorbar",size = "none")

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

# Integrated guides 

If possible, guides will be integrated.


<pre class="mcode">
dat <- data.frame(x = 1:5, y = 1:5, p = 1:5, q = factor(1:5),
 r = factor(1:5))

p <-
  ggplot(dat, aes(x, y, colour = p, size = q, shape = r)) +
  geom_point()

p <-    
 p +
  guides(
    colour = guide_legend("title"),
    size = guide_legend("title"),
    shape = guide_legend("title")
 )
 
plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

You can also create the previous plot in this way too:


<pre class="mcode">
dat <- data.frame(x = 1:5, y = 1:5, p = 1:5, q = factor(1:5),
 r = factor(1:5))

p <-
  ggplot(dat, aes(x, y, colour = p, size = q, shape = r)) +
  geom_point()

g <- guide_legend("title")

p <-  p + guides(colour = g, size = g, shape = g)

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

# Legend position


<pre class="mcode">
dat <- data.frame(x = 1:5, y = 1:5, p = 1:5, q = factor(1:5),
 r = factor(1:5))

p <-
  ggplot(dat, aes(x, y, colour = p, size = q, shape = r)) +
  geom_point()

g <- guide_legend("title")

p <-  p + theme(legend.position = "bottom")

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

# Guides position



<pre class="mcode">
dat <- data.frame(x = 1:5, y = 1:5, p = 1:5, q = factor(1:5),
 r = factor(1:5))

p <-
  ggplot(dat, aes(x, y, colour = p, size = q, shape = r)) +
  geom_point()

g <- guide_legend("title")

p <-    
 ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, cty)) +
  geom_point(aes(size = hwy, colour = cyl, shape = drv)) +
  guides(
   colour = guide_colourbar(order = 1),
   shape = guide_legend(order = 2),
   size = guide_legend(order = 3)
 )
 
plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>
